docs.lead_paragraph: A law that provides medical monitoring and treatment for Sept. 11 first responders expires at midnight Wednesday due to the failure of Congress to act.

headline.main: Federal Health Program for Sept. 11 Responders Set to Expire
headline.print_headline: Federal Health Program for Sept. 11 Responders Set to Expire

docs.snippet: A law that provides medical monitoring and treatment for Sept. 11 first responders expires at midnight Wednesday due to the failure of Congress to act.

docs.lead_paragraph: Coca-Cola says it will not renew its sponsorship of a professional group for dietitians, bringing to a halt one of many outreach efforts on health by the world's biggest soda maker.

headline.main: Coke Ending Sponsorship of Dietitians Group
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Coca-Cola to End Some Health and Nutrition Sponsorships

docs.abstract: Coca-Cola will not renew its sponsorship of professional group for dietitians as well as its current contracts with American Academy of Family Physicians, American Academy of Pediatrics and American College of Cardiology because of financial exigency.
docs.snippet: Coca-Cola says it will not renew its sponsorship of a professional group for dietitians, bringing to a halt one of many outreach efforts on health by the world's biggest soda maker.

docs.lead_paragraph: According to one estimate, spending on areas like lobbies, fitness rooms and guest rooms will reach $6.4 billion this year.

headline.main: Hotel Owners Looking to Stay Current Put Money in Properties
headline.print_headline: Hotel Owners Spending to Keep Brands Current

docs.abstract: Hotel owners in United States are spending $6.4 billion in 2015 to keep their brands current and attract younger travelers, who have replaced baby boomers as most coveted demographic; lobbies are being remade as areas for guests and locals.
docs.snippet: According to one estimate, spending on areas like lobbies, fitness rooms and guest rooms will reach $6.4 billion this year.
